revised_title: The Life and Intellectual Range of Charles Babbage
tldr: This article discusses the life and contributions of Charles Babbage, a polymath known for his work in computing machines. It highlights his book "On the Economy of Machinery and Manufactures," which was quoted by influential figures like Karl Marx and J.S. Mill, securing his place in the history of economics. The article also explores Babbage's autobiography, "Passages," which provides insights into his life, achievements, and the ways he felt he was mistreated by the world. Despite containing some inaccuracies, the book offers a fascinating look into Babbage's character and his ability to interact with people from all social levels.
